channel.title: Need help
channel.description: It's extremely hard to explain, add me on MSN: MrLove2Skillz@hotmail.com Must have Teamviewer!! Glimpse of the problem: I've been running a server for a month, this is the second month. Bought a new VPS and whatnot, and I portforwarded 43594 and whatnot - you run the server, go to canyouseeme.org and it's succeeded and it can see the ports opened. When I open the no-ip DUC, it says "IP: Error Connecting to Server - Retrying in 10s,9s,8s, etc".. And it's "offline".. I don't get it..

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“ApocalypseX, post:9, topic:401843”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=498899.msg3648463#msg3648463 date=1309552829]

When I open the no-ip DUC, it says “IP: Error Connecting to Server - Retrying in 10s,9s,8s, etc”…
And it’s “offline”… I don’t get it…

Meaning the no-ip client says you have an invalid hostname, as in you’re trying to update a DNS record (foo@no-ip.org) that’s expired?

I used my old No-IP, then created a new no-ip account and tried it, then made ANOTHER and tried it… :l

See if you can do a traceroute to no-ip’s server(s)?
[/quote]
Excuse me for my lack of knowlege, but traceroute to no-ip server? :O[/quote]

en.wikipedia.org

Traceroute

In computing, traceroute is a computer network diagnostic tool for displaying the route (path) and measuring transit delays of packets across an Internet Protocol (IP) network. The history of the route is recorded as the round-trip times of the packets received from each successive host (remote node) in the route (path); the sum of the mean times in each hop is a measure of the total time spent to establish the connection. Traceroute proceeds unless all (three) sent packets are lost more than twi...


To see if there’s a ‘breakage’ somewhere along your line.

Read full topic

Meaning the no-ip client says you have an invalid hostname, as in you’re trying to update a DNS record (foo@no-ip.org) that’s expired?

I used my old No-IP, then created a new no-ip account and tried it, then made ANOTHER and tried it… :l
[/quote]
See if you can do a traceroute to no-ip’s server(s)?[/quote]
Excuse me for my lack of knowlege, but traceroute to no-ip server?

Read full topic

@Tom wrote:

You’re not allowed to offer a reward for help on this community, help is free. I’ve gone ahead and edited your post.

If someone requests a payment then simply tell them no, many other people will do it for free.

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @ApocalypseX ApocalypseX
item.description:
@ApocalypseX wrote:

[quote=“x pk3r xx, post:2, topic:401843”]when creating your host on no-ip, make sure not to edit anything, but the server ip you want.

make sure your path and classpath are set

turn off your windows firewall

thats all i can think of that you would have to do to fix this[/quote]
Didn’t change anything.
Set.
Off.
And it still didn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @x_pk3r_xx x pk3r xx
item.description:
@x_pk3r_xx wrote:

when creating your host on no-ip, make sure not to edit anything, but the server ip you want.

make sure your path and classpath are set

turn off your windows firewall

thats all i can think of that you would have to do to fix this

Read full topic
